Name: Rewinding Raindrops
QuestDesc: The previous puzzle's answer has been revealed, but it only leads to another one. With a storm on the horizon, you follow the Magistrate's advice and search for clues about "the Black Shores".

Chapters.Title: Meet up with Yangyang and Chixia

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... I can feel the tension in the Streams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm worried something bad is going to happen...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There you are, Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Academy has noted a concerning rise in Tacet Field activities. Please use caution when exiting the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember to check your Terminal signals, and wear the Academy's protective suit correctly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Baizhi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And don't forget to stay hydrated. Now, I have experiments to run. Take care.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is she sending the same thing to everyone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just Baizhi being Baizhi. She's a little awkward with showing care, but I think it's cute!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway! Rover, quick, tell us what happened!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After a brief moment of thinking, you gave them a brief run down of your meeting with Jinhsi, but didn’t mention Jué's disappearance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus again? Ugh, those jerks!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jiyan the General, Jinhsi the Magistrate, and Jué, Jinzhou’s Sentinel... Is there any kind of connection between them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Connection? ...No idea, but I did hear General Jiyan used to be a military doctor...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Speaking of that, I think we'll need to start with a bit of Jinzhou's past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A storyteller near the theater once told us something like this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You reunite with Chixia and Yangyang outside City Hall, where the tension hangs in the air. Mentioning Jiyan's name prompts Yangyang to recount a tale about him as told by a certain storyteller...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woah. First time hearing about all that...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did Jué choose Jinhsi to be the Magistrate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uhhh... Maybe the Sentinel had its own special ways of picking candidates?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe it is their incomprehensible ways that set these divine beings apart from us? Their thinking tends to be elusive to the average person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, true. Wouldn't be surprised if Jué decided to make me the Magistrate one day, not gonna lie!

Options.PlotLineKey: Does it ever ask the opinion of the person selected?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand your concern.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Madam Jinhsi was only a teenager, and she was suddenly selected to be the Magistrate. It must have been so difficult for her...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember people were skeptical when she first took office.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite her achievements, many believed she lacked the necessary experience and authority in the political realm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People only showed their respect to Madam Jinhsi because they trusted Jué's judgment...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seriously, Lord Jué knows how to choose 'em. Our previous Magistrates were all top-notch at running the show.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Madam Jinhsi? She's already made this city a well-oiled machine in no time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd have a mental Overclock just trying to keep up with all that paperwork... She was made for this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, what is that saying again? Real gold never loses its shine!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, since you are asking about this... Did you get clues about your past from Madam Jinhsi?

Options.PlotLineKey: Jué asked me to go find Jiyan in the Norfall Barrens at a specific time.
There's another "Overseer" of the Fractsidus lurking in Jinzhou.
An organization called the Black Shores has been watching me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Norfall Barrens?! It's been a battlefield since ancient times...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, it's dangerous there. The Norfall Barrens is the frontline in our defense against the Threnodian. We must be careful about going there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They sent two Overseers at once... Their scheme must be far more expansive than we thought.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the Fractsidus do seem to know a lot about you... Their ideology and actions are too dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And right now, the odds are in their favor. If we rush into a confrontation, it could lead us into their traps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores? Doesn't ring a bell... Sounds like the name of a place, but I've never seen it on any map.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This flower... It's only a photo, and I can't tell where it came from with my ability.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores is an organization that studies the Lament.
Every Black Shores member wears a flower like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... We're still in the dark about Fractsidus' plans, and the Norfall Barrens is too risky. The Black Shores seems to be our only option now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if we are to look for them with only a photo of this flower... It's going to be difficult.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since it's about flowers... We should go ask Grandma Lin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! Grandma Lin runs a flower shop. I'm sure she can give us some tips.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... You're making me blush a little.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandma Lin loves listening to storytellers. I think I saw her earlier... Let's go look for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After hearing the story, you express your desire to find members of the Black Shores before heading to the Norfall Barrens. Yangyang suggests starting with the Blake Bloom, the organization's symbol.

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is still some time before the next session. Here are some books to keep you entertained before that, dear listeners.

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ask him about the "Battle Beneath the Crescent".)

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you want to learn more about that battle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say storytelling inevitably carries some subjective bias, all to enhance the ebb and flow of the narrative.

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when it comes to the "Battle Beneath the Crescent," we typically avoid adding any of our personal commentary, focusing instead on accurately retelling history.

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But even just telling the story carries a heavy emotional weight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was Geshu Lin truly an unforgivable sinner? Was General Jiyan the perfect hero?

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sudden onset of the Retroact Rain, the decision of our Sentinel, and the timing behind this series of events...

Dialogues.Speaker: Storyteller
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess it will be up to future generations to figure it all out, haha.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hello! Chixia, Yangyang, what brought you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Grandma Lin! We're here for some stories today, and here's our new friend!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ta-da! We've got the ultimate badass here! The one who can crush TDs, cook up Echoes, knock Inferno Rider flat, and KO Feilian Beringal with a single punch! The legendary Rover!

Options.PlotLineKey: No, I didn't... Please don't listen to her...
This lady looks too young to be called a Grandma.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, so you are the famous Rover! Oh, youngsters these days are really something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, that's just how Chixia talks. Please don't mind her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, you're such a sweetheart!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandma Lin, since you're the flower expert, I've got a favor to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have you seen flowers like this one before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I'm familar with most of the flowers local to Jinzhou, but this one... it doesn't match anything we have here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't think I've seen anything similar, not even in the plant encyclopedias...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh no... If not even a flower expert like you can recognize it, who else could help us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, Chixia, I'm far from an expert. We've got a plant-type Resonator here in Jinzhou, remember? She knows the plants much better than me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, are you talking about that young lady? I always see her helping out at your store.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, she has been a great help. She knows a lot about everything plant related.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And she is such a sweet child. Her smiles always make me happy. She reminds me of the lovely Starflowers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd call out to her: Lil Starflower, it's dinner time! And she'd always answer with her brightest smile. What a lovely girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's probably up in the back mountain doing some field research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My apologies, but I don't remember... I'm too old to work these fancy stuff...

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's probably up in the back mountain doing some field research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, how I wish she was my granddaughter...

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's probably up in the back mountain doing some field research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I said I wanted a field in the back mountain and she offered to help right away. That's where she is now, checking it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go in that direction, and soon you'll see a waterfall. Walk right through the waterfall, then you'll reach the back mountain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you so much, Grandma Lin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Linsu
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, anytime, dearie! Don't forget to visit my Penjing shop. I'll have treats ready for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You inquire about the Blake Bloom from Grandma Lin, who has not seen it but knows a Resonator skilled in botany. This Resonator is currently in the mountains, where you set off to find her.

Chapters.Title: Go to the waterfall behind the square

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This should be the shortcut to the back mountain. Once we cross the waterfall, we'll reach Mt. Pingting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The flowers seem to be showing us the way. Let's follow it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A bridge of flowers... That's impressive...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello... Are you lost? Do you need help?

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops, sorry! I should've introduced myself first... I know it's a polite thing to do in Huanglong...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Starflower? That's what Grandma Lin likes to call me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops, sorry! I should've introduced myself first... I know it's a polite thing to do in Huanglong...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is… It is a delight to make your acquaintance. I am Verina. My "pressure" to have the opportunity to meet with you today…

Options.PlotLineKey: What if we were some bad guys? Aren't you worried?

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My apologies. I used to live in the New Federation, so I'm not very familiar with the language here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My apologies. I used to live in the New Federation, so I'm not very familiar with the etiquette here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? Really? But that flower next to you said she likes you a lot...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plants don't lie. I trust their words, so you can't be bad guys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi, Verina! I'm Chixia, this is Yangyang, and {Male=he;Female=she}'s Rover! Grandma Lin told us we should come find you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, right. Grandma Lin talked about you. I left those flowers so she knows how to reach me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What seems to be the trouble? If there's anything I can help you with...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're looking for a special flower...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... It's an unusual flower indeed. Pure black flowers are rarely found in nature. We can't rule out the possibility that it's been dyed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When looking at the structure, there are a few types of flowers that seem similar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take Iris, for example. Its petals are similarly oval-shaped, but it has double petals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not Viola, either, since Viola has notched petals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then there's also the Cliffrecluse, but this flower has a longer stamen and an extra petal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lemongrass is also similar in shape. It's native to the New Federation, and Huanglong people may not be familiar with it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though it has a similar stamen length, it has a conical inflorescence with a trumpet-shaped corolla.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and I almost forgot the Pecok Flower! It's a single-petaled flower with a similar stamen length!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... The Pecok Flower has a distinct peduncle, while this one doesn't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, you really know your stuff! I learned a lot from that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, this black flower does look very special. There are hardly any similar plants in nature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, I'm thinking it might be a newly cultivated species.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, its veins are somehow cross-shaped... I can feel some faint traces of frequency fluctuations on it too. It's a sign of overflowing Remnant Energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, my guess is it should be an unique Remnant plant, created by a certain type of Resonance Energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But in order to figure out the right soil for it, or exactly what type of Resonance Energy it is, I need more than just a picture.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gosh, help us out, someone! We don't know what kind of flower it is, and we haven't seen anyone wearing it either...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of that... How does it even work? If I wore this flower on me right now, do I automatically become one of them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia, wait, what did you just say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uhhh... Yeah? I was just saying if I wore this flower, would they immediately see me as one of their own...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If this black flower is indeed their symbol, the Black Shores members should immediately notice it on you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But to all the other people, it would only look like a peculiar flower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Given that... if they are indeed in Jinzhou city, we may only need to wear this flower to lure them out...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ohh, I see... but how do we get our hands on one?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resonator Verina identifies the black flower in your photo as a specially cultivated variety. This inspires the idea of wearing a Blake Bloom to draw out members of the organization. But how does one go about conjuring a Blake Bloom from thin air?

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Erm, I... I could probably make one for you with my Resonance Ability... If you just need something that looks similar...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, Verina, you can do it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way? That's amazing, seriously! It looks exactly like the flower in that picture!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-thank you, it's nothing... I'm glad I could help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's friggin amazing! Could you do that again? Please! I love it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Verina uses her Resonance Abilities to conjure a black flower that perfectly matches the one in the photo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, have you noticed?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've been seeing these black petals for a while now... They're scattered all over the place. I’m pretty sure they're not made by Miss Verina.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Streams have been disrupted... Someone has been following us.

Options.PlotLineKey: You two should head back to the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover... Are you sure you want us to leave? It could be dangerous for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Okay. Chixia and I will wear these black flowers and go look for members of the Black Shores in the city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, please be careful. Rings us anytime when you need help.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Noticing you are being followed, you decide to send Chixia and Yangyang with the Blake Bloom to search for Black Shores members in the city while you confront your mysterious stalker.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, did you see that? Miss Verina just conjured up this exquisite Blake Bloom out of thin air!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And! It looks exactly like the one in the photo!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Erm, it's just my Resonance Ability...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could you please make another one? Then there'll be one for each of us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, I-I'll give it another try...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, I see! And guess what? Miss Verina just made another Blake Bloom for us. Now it comes in handy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy peasy! I've got this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Verina, we should get you home now.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, it's dangerous out in the wild lately.
It's dinner time. Grandma Lin is waiting for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Ah, sure. One moment, please...

Chapters.Title: Locate where the sound is coming from

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Fractsidus? What are they doing in a place like this?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn that woman! Always getting in our way... And what are you doing here? Get lost!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (...I'll have to take them down first.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The weird noises persist. They're coming after me.)

Chapters.Title: Find a suitable place to lure out your stalker

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (If I climb up to that point, I should be able to get behind that person.)

Chapters.Title: Find a suitable place to lure out your stalker
Find a suitable place to lure out your stalker

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Better hide here for now.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Where is {Male=he;Female=she} hiding?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looking for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh, here you are.
You're such a box full of surprises.
So we're playing truth-or-dare now? I see... Oops!
Hehe... Getting angry, are we? Sorry, but it's just so much fun to rile you up.
You're the very first person to pique my interest like this. You... have great potential.
Okay, so you're not up for small talk. I'll keep that in mind. You're my mission target, after all.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you from the Black Shores?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bingo! I'm one of the Bloom Bearers of the Black Shores.
This Blake Bloom is our symbol. It represents our mission to save the world.
That's what it says in the rules, at least.

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you planning to do with me?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our plans? Hmm... What is it again? To recruit as many talents as we can, and save the world from its impending doom.
So, are you in?

Options.PlotLineKey: You don't sound like you want to save the world.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nuh-uh, I don't! The world? Couldn't care less. If it's all going BOOM tomorrow, why not have fun while we can?
To stop at nothing for more power, take down any prey without mercy, and indulge in all our desires for the ultimate pleasure...

Options.PlotLineKey: How are you any different from the Fractsidus then...

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... I mean, I'd love to live that way, but alas, duty calls.
<ano=The Black Shores>Our "Garden"</ano> is home to many green fruits, and we'll make you the most special "Seed" among them all...
My duty is to nurture and safeguard seeds like you, allowing them to blossom into luscious fruits.
Then once the fruit ripens, I'll get to pick it, and indulge the sweetness of my labor all by myself.

You're just like what <ano=Civilization Simulation Sand Table>Tethys</ano> has told us... I can feel such explosive potential within you. One day, you'll surely bear the most beautiful fruit imaginable.
Hehe... I like how cold you sound. You're tempting me to push your buttons a bit more...
Relax, relax. I'll behave for the time being.
No need to be so on edge. I won't do anything... strange, to you, I think?
Actually, I've been diligently protecting you, you know? I got rid of all types of pests that tried to get in your way!

Ew, don't mention me and the Fractsidus in the same sentence. I couldn't care less about their petty games, but if they even think of laying their dirty fingers on you... Hmph. You're mine, and I don't like sharing.
Just a couple tricks and I had those fools flapping around like headless chickens. What a boring crowd.
Woah, don't tell me you haven't noticed?
Enjoyed your nightly rendezvous with that Loong Maiden? You have me to thank for keeping those Fractsidus people away.
Well... I've answered plenty of questions already. Now it's your turn.

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you want to ask?
Is this how you treat the talents you're trying to recruit?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, nothing in particular.
The way you look at me though, it's almost as if... No, forget about it.

Options.PlotLineKey: We've been in this position for long enough now.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Cough... Do you think I'd entertain... your inquiries, if I didn't have a blade on my throat?...
Anyway, I'm not trying to get any answers from you...
But I'll be watching you. You're a very special "Seed", that I am very sure.
I can feel something oddly familiar about you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name is Camellya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Camellya
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Try not to let me catch you so easily next time~!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And she's gone... Huh, that was fast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You apprehend the mysterious young woman stalking you, only to discover she is a Bloom Bearer from the Black Shores. She shows a strong interest in you and reveals she has been helping you from afar. In a flash, she manages to escape leaving only her name—Camellya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, what took you so long to pick up the call? Did something happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a friend or foe? Are you hurt?

Options.PlotLineKey: I am safe, thank you for asking.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores... Did she tell you anything?

Options.PlotLineKey: A shame. I let her get away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... At least you are safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew... At least you are safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia noticed a guy acting suspicious. I think she's keeping an eye on him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, we are in the shopping district. See you then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang calls to inform you that she and Chixia have spotted a suspicious figure on Main Street.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, there you are!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We walked on the streets, wearing the Blake Bloom like you said. Talked to various people, but I didn't hear anything useful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing in particular, just some small talks...

Dialogues.Speaker: Kind Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, aren't you the girl from earlier?

Dialogues.Speaker: Passionate Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! You're so pretty! Can I take another selfie with you? The one we did earlier looked a bit blurry...

Options.PlotLineKey: Understandable. I want a selfie with you too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: P-please stop teasing me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia did say she found someone suspicious... Look, it's him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: P-please stop teasing me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia did say she found someone suspicious... Look, it's him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chixia did say she found someone suspicious... Look, it's him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You meet Yangyang who points out the enigmatic man.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, perfect timing! This guy's been sniffin' around here for a while now. He keeps trying to talk to the elderly and minors! I've been keeping an eye on him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I saw a little girl with him! She kept turning her head and looking around, but now she's nowhere to be found. This is super fishy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, I'm Patroller Chixia. Sir, business license, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-Business license? Uuuhh... Oh! I'm Aalto, just a humble information broker. I've been travelling around, helping people out in my own small way...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. So, no license. I bet you don't have a fixed business location either, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Business location? Why would I need that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, now show me your Organizational Accreditation, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... I am an honest broker of information, always open to negotiations at the right price! I'm the all-time Intel champ, with more Best Seller certificates than I can count...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No license, no clear business plan... You're running an illegal business, then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who's your supervisor? You should at least have their ID number?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My s-supervisor? Oh right! She's, like, a super big deal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's an ancient being, born with this planet we're living on. She's the will of the star, the reverberation of everything in this world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So do you even have a supervisor or not?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? C'mon, I already told you about her! Why won't you believe me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, yeah! I believe you! I know what's going on!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, sir, you're coming with me to the Patroller Station!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, come on! Please, I didn't do anything illegal! I was just looking for someone!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A little girl, um, about this tall... She's the kind to stand out in any crowd!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really think I'm gonna buy that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, you know! You saw her earlier! It's that girl!

Options.PlotLineKey: She seems to bounce while she walks?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! Exactly! Wait, how do you know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He introduces himself as Aalto, an information broker. He claims to be searching for a little girl who suddenly appears.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, please watch out... It's dangerous to run like that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here you are! Hurray!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore! I looked everywhere for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back off! Leave that girl alone!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Patroller, she's the girl I've been looking for!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, little one. Is your name Encore? Do you know this person?

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes! Encore knows him!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uncle Aalto sells stuff without a license, he listens in on people for commercial secrets, and he loves pulling pranks on us kids... But he’s not a bad guy, really!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, Encore! Remember our little chat?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did I say about calling me "Uncle" in public again? I am NOT that old!

Options.PlotLineKey: That doesn't add up with what you just said.
You sound really suspicious to me.
Is *that* what you're gonna focus on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Miss Verina, where did you meet this girl?

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I ran into her near a cliff on my way home. She was eating a poisonous mushroom...

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I managed to make her the antidote in time. Imagine what would have happened if I wasn't there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry! Encore's had plenty of that mushroom already!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why did you go to such a dangerous place alone, little Encore?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got your back, little one! No worries! Just tell us what you know!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because... Because Encore must keep an eye on {Male=him;Female=her}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahahaha... Kids can have such wild imaginations sometimes, haha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Aalto? Didn't you send Encore there? Wait... Why are they all giving you the side eye?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore... Some things are better left unspoken, you know...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since the situation has come to this, I've got no choice but to tell you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed! We're here for business. And it's a crucial one! You wanna know what it is?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's go, Encore!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Aalto! Wait for meeee!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See ya! We still have a world to save!

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cough cough... Wait!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl's name is Encore, and she is Aalto's associate. Just when she is about to divulge a crucial secret, Aalto snaps his fingers and they both vanish in a cloud of mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cough... We can't let him get away!

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'll go search in the residential area!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "mist figure" of Aalto. It's posed in a weird way, as if he's an eagle spreading his wings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Did he leave it here to mock you? You're not quite sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In front of the "mist figure", there is a floating line of handwriting, also made out of fog: "We value integrity and quality above all else! New customers enjoy 20% off!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh! What is this? Is he mocking us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go down that way towards the Patrol Station! I know the streets here like the back of my hand!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "mist figure" of Aalto. It's posed in a weird way, as if he's stretching his arms wide for a welcome hug.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Did he leave it here to mock you? You're not quite sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In front of the "mist figure", there is a floating line of handwriting, also made out of fog: "Fate brings us together; may our friendship endure forever!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's another split in the road...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll go look for him in the square. I'll leave the other side to you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "mist figure" of Aalto. It's posed in a weird way, as if he's making a heart with his hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Did he leave it here to mock you? You're not quite sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In front of the "mist figure", there is a floating line of handwriting, also made out of fog: "Patience please, the answer is right around the corner!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The gaps between each "mist figure" are shrinking... Over there, at the end of that alley!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Ha, now you're here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Where are you going to run off to this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, we weren't really running from you! We just wanted to make sure you were alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be good, please!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore and Uncle Aalto won't do anything bad to you...

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you want from me?!
She just called you an uncle again!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's enough Encore, you're freaking our precious client out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore just did as Aalto said! Encore is usually a good girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be scared, Rover. We just have a few questions for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was it your idea to have those two ladies wear those counterfeit Blake Blooms and attract our attention?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must admit, they looked quite convincing. If I was an outsider, I might mistake them for the real deal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you worked with a plant-type Resonator... Interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A plant-type Resonator? We happen to know someone like that too, don't we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. There are more than one of them out there. Not a big deal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So please, tell us... What do you want from the Black Shores?

Options.PlotLineKey: My past might be related to the Black Shores.
Now you're finally biting the hook.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Hmm, what if I told you... We have the information you want the most?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Really? So that lead about you was right indeed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, not bad, you've managed to catch on real quick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like what they say here in Huanglong: the straight hook is for willing fish to bite. Ta-daa da daah! Your efforts finally caught our attention.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Surprise! The people you've been looking for are right in front of you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, how's that for a piece of intel? I'll let you have it free of charge!

Options.PlotLineKey: You're both from the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, not that disappointed look! Are we not what you had in mind?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, not that disappointed look! Gotta learn how to enjoy a surprise while you can, or life gets real boring, you know?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you must have a ton of questions for me, but one moment, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you already know, I'm an "information broker".

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That means I make deals instead of passing out freebies. You want information from me, you gotta give me something in return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Relax, Rover. We just want to make a deal with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We want you to come with us to an abandoned Court of Savantae facility, to help us recover a "Resonance Beacon".

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In turn, I'll tell you everything we know so far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our business is centered around customer satisfaction and built on integrity! Otherwise, we wouldn't qualify as Consultants of the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, if you don't take this opportunity, you'll probably never get to learn more about the Black Shores again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And since you're a first-time customer... I'm pleased to offer you an additional gift.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, have this. This should prove we're serious, since you already know what it represents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if you still have doubts about us... Just show it to that plant-savvy young miss. She'll be able to tell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally, as a last resort...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore, do your cute face, quick!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww... Pwease help us... Pretty Pweeaaase...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at this poor child, pleading to you like that! How could anyone have the heart to decline?! The deal's settled then!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be waiting for you near this Beacon in Whining Aix's Mire! And don't forget to come alone, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You track them down and discover they are Consultants for the Black Shores. Aalto strikes a deal to reveal what he knows about you in exchange for your help in recovering a Resonance Beacon from the Court of Savantae Ruins, in Whining Aix's Mire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, did you find them?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes. They're from the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? Seriously? No way...

Options.PlotLineKey: They gave me this Blake Bloom.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I expected! This flower is indeed a type of Remnant plant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Verina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And it contains a very unique kind of Remnant Energy. The concentration is much higher than usual, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way, are they really from the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tsk... Not as mysterious as people make 'em out to be. Well at least they're good at running, I'll give them that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What did they tell you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I made a deal with them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You explained the current situation...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That place... I only heard it's an abandoned research institution. There's nothing special about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because of the dangerous weather conditions in Whining Aix's Mire, it's been ages since anyone went there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Yangyang. We all know how strong our Rover is!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay... Rover, I'll tell the Academy about this, and they'll help transmit your data from the Resonance Nexus. Then that Beacon in the Whining Aix's Mire should be unlocked for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There have been frequent Tacet Field activities recently. If you're going there alone, please be careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chixia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just ring us whenever you need a hand! We'll come rushing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After Aalto and Encore depart, Chixia and the others arrive. You brief them on your deal. Yangyang warns that Whining Aix's Mire hasn't been visited in ages due to treacherous weather and urges caution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heya, Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've sent the coordinates of that CSC research facility to your Terminal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that we're in the same boat, let me fill you in on what we're getting into before we dive in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Court of Savantae is a mysterious scientific research organization. They are best known for their research in "Automata Mechanics", but...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What really put them on the map isn't that; it's all the bizarre experiments they did.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's with the psychedelic black light coming from Mourning Aix's Mire, and is that freaky ring in the waters really the lake monster's doing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, a daring young scientist soared into the sky and never returned... Could this be the beginning of another diabolical plot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto, why are you telling bedtime stories now? Is it time to sleep already?

Options.PlotLineKey: And then what happened? I want more!
What kind of stories have you been listening to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem, my bad. Old habits die hard. But the big part is coming right up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, out of the blue, every single Court of Savantae member VANISHED!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The last words from that mysterious researcher, the Court of Savantae Committee's Chairman, was this—

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "You want my research? You can have it! I left everything I gathered in the Court of Savantae's labs. Now you'll just have to find it..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think, Rover? Aren't you curious?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha! I knew you'd be into this like I am! But stories aside, we do have an important mission on our hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, don't go! We really do have an important mission on our hands!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suppose the Magistrate of Jinzhou has already told you what we do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've set up Resonance Beacons worldwide to monitor the Lament, collecting data in real-time. This is how we predict when the next Lament is happening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the saying goes, one miss is as good as a mile. Every single one of the Resonance Beacons is crucial.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the Court of Savantae researchers disappeared, all of our Resonance Beacons near their facilities were damaged to varying degrees.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recently, something went wrong with our Lament detection system, and we suspected it had something to do with a damaged Beacon around the area.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why we've been sent here, to investigate the case.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While our main goal is to retrieve the lost Resonance Beacon, we also might find some treasures.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto, even Encore can tell what you're up to...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's called seize the opportunity while I can! You're just too young to get it! Come on, let's go!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After meeting Aalto and Encore, you learn that the Beacon is hidden within the Court of Savantae Ruins, a once-revered institution known for its groundbreaking research in Automata Mechanics and strange experiments. Its members vanished without a trace, leaving behind only damaged Resonance Beacons.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Court of Savantae Facility

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Is my TD Detector working? How come it didn't warn us of so many Tacet Discords ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cause they all just appeared outta nowhere!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's weird... Anyway, let's deal with them.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Court of Savantae Facility

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, those savants really love their puzzles, don't they...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wonder folks never managed to get inside after all these years. Their security is top-notch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's because Aalto set off the security alarm! And now the gate's closed, hmph!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... Anyway! We've got to figure out how to open it up again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It looks like a sundial, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe if we spin the dials to align every pointer in the same direction...

Chapters.Title: Enter the Court of Savantae Facility

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is... No wonder...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those crazy savants... They were trying to recreate the Retroact Rain...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never thought they could pull off something like this... Incredible...

Options.PlotLineKey: What on earth is the Retroact Rain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Retroact Rain is essentially a form of condensed Remnant Energy from the Etheric Sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Various events across space and time from every dimension are recorded in the form of Remnant Energy. The Retroact Rain conjures illusions of past events for those exposed to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That rain curtain we saw earlier was probably the results of their experiments.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the Retroact Rain forms, it goes through three stages. In the first stage, it looks just like any regular rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And what we're seeing now should be the second stage: Water droplets floating in midair, being absolutely still.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard of plenty independant studies on the Retroact Rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Most of the researchers were driven by their obsessions. Some wanted to relive a particular experience, while others yearned to reunite with their loved ones...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But look at all these devices here... The sheer scale of this research is really something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It really makes one wonder... What on earth were they trying to bring back with such a massive Retroact Rain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto is amazed to learn that the Court of Savantae had once attempted to recreate Retroact Rain, speculating on what they sought to achieve.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The power system here might still work... Let's split up and find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hurray! Woolies, thataway!

Chapters.Title: Find a way to turn the electricity on
Find a way to turn the electricity on

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That Fractsidus Overseer has been really generous with his sponsorship... It would have taken us much longer to build this place without him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though he loves to meddle with our experiments a bit too much... Well, he's our patron, can't do anything about that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This lab's location is a bit too remote for me, but I'm okay with it as long as we can keep doing our research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Female Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... Where else could us "maniacs" possibly go?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Committee kicked us out like trash... They'll never understand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Professor Heisen stated, we are embarking on a monumental endeavor with the power to redefine humanity's future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time, we will make the "divine miracle" we saw happen again for all of humanity to behold!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The experiments have been going smoothly, but we still can't get the desired outcome… Why?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The "Artificial Retroactive Rain" project has advanced to its second phase... We have various evidence that this ancient civilization was the Whining Aix's Mire at some point.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We believed we could recreate that “divine miracle” with the artificial Retroact Rain... have we been mistaken?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have no time left. The "Artificial Controllable Tacet Field" should be complete by now... We’ll have to rely on our backup plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's Subject A038 doing lately?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Female Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It has yet to assume a concrete form or exhibit vocalization behavior. In most cases, it remains motionless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Female Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, we've noticed some behavioral discrepancies from our initial expectations, and further observation and research would be necessary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's merely a "replica", after all. It's far from the true form of those "gods"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, things have been mysteriously disappearing lately. Any idea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Female Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You noticed it too? Thought I was imagining things... And there's weird noises at the lab late at night.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Female Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I suspect it has something to do with Subject A038... Lately, its frequencies have always displayed signs of "hunger".

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Female Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But it's been under strict surveillance. That couldn't possibly be A038... Right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'll go check the security cameras once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's increase its rations. We can't afford to let it go hungry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hologram of a Male Researcher
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, it's our last hope now...

Chapters.Title: Find a way to turn the electricity on

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, this is the last room...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto, Rover! Encore spotted something!

Chapters.Title: Activate the device on the wall

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's getting closer. These will be my final words, haha... If only I had more time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought my enemies were misconceptions, waning passion, and my own ignorance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only in the end did I realize... time is my ultimate foe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I became blindsided by my fear of death and insatiable thirst for truth, eventually derailing our research...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was too late when I finally came back to my senses... We... We had already walked into that false "Gate"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I'm leaving my last realization behind...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are our "past"... but they are also our "future"... Had I realized it sooner, there might have been a chance to get things back on track...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The future being hailing from our past... Please save us... once again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder Male Voice
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, keep pushing forward... until you reach... the real Gate that can change the world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow... She's so pretty...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, about this person...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, knew it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, now that power's been restored, that elevator should work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Beacon's signal is coming from below. Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You come across a hologram of an aged man, lamenting his unfulfilled research and hoping for a savior 'from both past and future.' A beautiful woman's specter briefly meets your gaze, stirring a sense of familiarity that eludes you.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to the basement
Take the elevator to the basement

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow! A big cluncky monster!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Damn... Those savants never run out of new surprises for us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The signal's coming from it. Did it swallow our Resonance Beacon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like peace isn't an option. Guys, brace yourself. We'll need to take it down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aalto, we doing it like we usually do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, then this big guy is Encore's to tackle!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cosmos, Cloudy, ATTACK!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me figure out its weakness...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see! It’s cobbled together from these metal parts!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should target its joints, use the fallen parts to counter its attacks and destroy its unstable structure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew, job done!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, Encore is strong! Told ya!

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why did they keep that big guy here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to our findings earlier, researchers who worked here were probably only a small faction of the Court of Savantae Committee.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They were likely studying an ancient civilization they deemed to be "divine beings", but later got denounced from the CSC due to their extreme methods.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Somehow, they believed this ancient civilization had once visited the Mire, which led to their attempts at recreating those past events with artificial Retroact Rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And when they failed to recreate the Retroact Rain, they resorted to making a "replica" of the lost civilization instead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To get their desired results faster, they started feeding this "replica" various frequencies, datasets, and mechanical constructs...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And we've seen what that ended up with. It turned into a monster driven by the frequencies of "hunger," devouring everything in its path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was probably the culprit behind the disappearance of those folks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And, I suspect, the Fractsidus Overseer mentioned in that log may have something to do with it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those researchers... They were too obsessed with validating the "divine miracle", they eventually got lured in by that monster's frequencies of hunger and willingly walked into its maw...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The monster devoured them, but not with its teeth... Their own delusions and fear were their undoing in the end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a crazy bunch...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So Rover, now it's time for me to fulfill my promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you want to know about the Black Shores?

Options.PlotLineKey: What on earth does the Black Shores do?
Do you know a person named Camellya?
What are you doing in Jinzhou?
What is the relationship between me and the Black Shores?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you already know, we monitor and research the Lament, and we’ve got Resonance Beacons set up in every nation worldwide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The island our headquarters are built on is in fact a massive piece of Tacetite ore, which powers our various energy-intensive operations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Blake Bloom is a product of that overflowing energy on the island.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our island is located in the perfect spot to accurately monitor the Lament, ensuring precise predictions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That being said, the Lament's behavior is constantly changing and we are still studying to understand its true nature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All we can do for now is to observe the Lament, study its patterns, and provide early warnings to countries worldwide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright, no more beating around the bush. Yeah, we've had our eyes on you, but please trust me, we don't mean anything bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We just wanted to make sure you're a dependable ally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores members all work together to save the world from the Lament crisis. We've got talents from all walks of life, including skilled hackers, explosive experts, and even Fengshui masters... You name it, we have it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We like your skills and methods. So, what do you say? Ready to jump on board?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Camellya? Course we do!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, she can be kinda unhinged, but she's indeed one of ours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just so you know, she only took up this mission because of you! Quite the charmer, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've met her already? Nice, saves me some time introducing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know she can be a bit too... straightforward, in how she expresses herself, but... Don't worry. She won't do anything bad to you, really.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We just received a warning from our Lament detection system. Another Threnodian is about to revive near Jinzhou city.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So we came here to inform Jinzhou's Magistrate about it.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did similar things happen in the past?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Entire countries had been destroyed... We're not letting such tragedies happen again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Entire countries had been destroyed... We're not letting such tragedies happen again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just an insignificant Consultant at the Black Shores, so I don't know that much about all its hidden secrets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I believe the piece of intel I'm about to share with you will make this trip worth your effort.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is not the first time you've been reawakened. Last time... You woke up at the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, we share the same goal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're both aiming to fight against the Threnodians and prevent the Lament crisis.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yep! Encore can prove it! The Threnodian is a bad, bad guy, and Encore and Aalto are the heroes of justice, so we're gonna stop the bad guys!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand. Trust isn't something you can afford to give out that easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember the Blake Bloom I gave you earlier?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is more than just a symbol. It also holds the key to our headquarters. I'm sure it will come in handy for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew! Anyway, mission accomplished! We've got the Resonance Beacon secured, plus a sweet bonus of Court of Savantae's big secrets!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Glad I got you on board, Rover. Looking forward to our future collaborations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oops, almost forgot! Gotta check that Resonance Beacon again, just in case.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, it can't be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, Aalto! WAAITT!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Upon defeating the monster, Aalto discloses shocking truths about you, the Black Shores, and Camellya. You learn this is not the first time you have awakened from a long slumber—the last happened at the Black Shores. Before you can ask more, he suddenly flees sensing something amiss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Encore heard lightning! When there's lightning, it's gonna rain, and when it's gonna rain, Encore should bring an umbrella...

Dialogues.Speaker: Encore
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Uh, no, no no no... Aalto said when it rains like this, we hide!

Options.PlotLineKey: It's just ordinary rain, isn't it?
Is this part of the Court of Savantae's experiment?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aalto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It's the real Retroact Rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, Jinzhou...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou is under attack! It's a TD Outbreak!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Emerging from the ruins, you find the sky dark and heavy with Retroact Rain. Yangyang calls to tell you Jinzhou is under attack by a horde of Tacet Discords.
